flight_system
Class FlightLeg

java.lang.Object
  flight_system.FlightLeg

public class FlightLeg
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to represent a flight leg based on the information provided by the XML files in the flight database system.

Author:
Richard Walker
See Also:
XMLGetter.getFlightsXML(boolean, Airport, Date)

Constructor Detail

FlightLeg

public FlightLeg(Airplane airplane,
                 int flightNum,
                 int flightDuration,
                 Time departureTime,
                 Date departureDate,
                 Airport departureAirport,
                 Time arrivalTime,
                 Date arrivalDate,
                 Airport arrivalAirport,
                 double firstClassPrice,
                 int firstClassSeatsOcc,
                 double coachClassPrice,
                 int coachClassSeatsOcc)
Makes an object that represents a flight leg.

The flight leg data represents the data that is represented by the XML data that is on the database.

Parameters:
airplane - the airplane that is used for the flight
flightNum - the flight number
flightDuration - the duration of the flight in minutes
departureTime - the departure time
departureDate - the departure date
departureAirport - the departure airport
arrivalTime - the arrival time
arrivalDate - the arrival date
arrivalAirport - the arrival airport
firstClassPrice - the price per first class seat
firstClassSeatsOcc - the the number of occupied first class seats
coachClassPrice - the price per coach class seat
coachClassSeatsOcc - the number of occupied coach class seats

getFirstClassSeatsAvail

public int getFirstClassSeatsAvail()
Gets the number of First Class seats that are on this flight.

Returns:
the number of seats available on the flight.

If the flight is full it will return 0. If the flight is over-packed, it will return the number of seats it is over packed by as a negative number. E.g. If the plane can only seat 10, yet the flight info says it has 12 seats booked, then it will return -2.

areFirstSeatsAvail

public boolean areFirstSeatsAvail()
Checks if there are available first class seats.

Returns:
true if there are available first class seats.

getCoachClassPrice

public double getCoachClassPrice()
Gets the price for each coach class seat.

Returns:
the price for each coach class seat.

getOccCoachClassSeats

public int getOccCoachClassSeats()
Gets the number of coach class seats that are occupied.

Returns:
the number of occupied coach class seats.

getCoachClassSeatsAvail

public int getCoachClassSeatsAvail()
Gets the number of Coach seats that are on this flight.

Returns:
the number of seats available on the flight.

If the flight is full it will return 0. If the flight is over-packed, it will return the number of seats it is over packed by as a negative number. E.g. If the plane can only seat 10, yet the flight info says it has 12 seats booked, then it will return -2.

areCoachSeatsAvail

public boolean areCoachSeatsAvail()
Checks if there are available coach class seats.

Returns:
true if there are available coach class seats.

userToString

public java.lang.String userToString()
Gets the information about the flight in a format thats more useful for the user.

The only difference between this and toString() is that this method displays how many seats are available on a flight, as opposed to the number of seats occupied.

Returns:
a string that contains the information about the flight, in a user-friendly format.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The String representation of the object contains all the information about the flight leg that would be useful for the developer. If you want flight info that is more presentable for the end user, use the userToString() method.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the string representation of the object.
